Articles.Content:
http://www.wildheretic.com/there-is-glass-in-the-sky/

This guy's blog. I found this one day when searching for images of atmoshpheric re-entry. It's too ridiculous for me to do anything byt laugh at t. Other theories? The Sun is a lightbulb. Hubble and the ISS are a hoax. NASA fakes stars. The moon and planets are fakes. This guy, is the epitome of Fractal Wrongness

http://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Fractal_wrongness

Everything... Ow.

His idea of an atmosphere curve is really funny. At 100km, almost no air: True. ASL, lots of air: True. Therefore, there is almost no air until ASL: False.

"At what altitude is Ã¢â‚¬Å“just short of orbital velocity?Ã¢â‚¬Â Just under 100 km." OWWWW!!! STOP IT!! You're hurting me.

"Only the shuttle itself and intercontinental missiles can do so as they are the only ones with reinforced carbon nose cones (and front wing edges)." So, nothing else has ever been to space. It all fits! ...Only it doesn't.
fortunately his page is so whack it wouldnt scroll on my ipad
I wouldn't even bother spreading this poo further, but if you have to, use one of those services that hide links, so that Google doesn't index it on this forum.
How do I do that?
Glass.......not sure if worse than flat earthers.
Don't worry, the whole website is a cleverly-made troll/satire. It took a while for me to confirm that but now I'm sure.

Don't worry, the whole website is a cleverly-made troll/satire. It took a while for me to confirm that but now I'm sure.

That's the problem with internet. Often, you can't be sure if something is satire or not.

What made you think this is?
Glass in the sky ... Oh yeah ... this explains the lensing effect and the greenhouse effect, naturally!
Holy mother, and some people take that serious?? Some of the comments on there.... someone even quoted the Bible, always a reassuring thing when you discuss science

That's the problem with internet. Often, you can't be sure if something is satire or not.

What made you think this is?

I think this is appropriate:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poe's_law
My point exactly. Which brings us back to my question.
Haven't seen any proof that this is satire on a cursory search. Sounds like run down the mills crazy like many others.

These are ther kinds of people that scare me the most... either they will end up crashing planes into buildings or going on a shooting rampage.

No doubt... this guy is Presidential material....

Wow...this is just...wow...last time I felt like this was when I opened Flat Earth Society wiki.

Space Shuttle TPS is so brittle rain will destroy it, and you want us to believe it plows into glass at 25000 km/h? I usually read conspiracy theories for fun when I'm bored, but this is too much.

either they will end up crashing planes into buildings or going on a shooting rampage..

Precisely.
Of course the sun is a lightbulb... I get paid good money to change it once in a while.

Anything from this guy.

https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMorgile

I refuse to believe he's serious.

That's the problem with internet. Often, you can't be sure if something is satire or not.

What made you think this is?

Because it's so over the top, I assume. Of course, I also assumed that the website of the Westborough Baptist Church was satire, because it simply couldn't be real. So yeah, there's that.
I notice he isn't even really trying, he quotes that spaceship one never made it past 100km, when it did, several times.
People actually believe this stuff!!?!!!??? Gotta get outta here before I have an anuerism.

"There has to be something solid up there at just above 100 km to absorb the infra-red rays of the Sun to cause such a drastic change of temperature from one side of that altitude to the other."

Ouch... That logic actually hurts.

"There has to be something solid up there at just above 100 km to absorb the infra-red rays of the Sun to cause such a drastic change of temperature from one side of that altitude to the other."

Ouch... That logic actually hurts.

and of course to keep the air in, else it floats away into space
What is interesting about this guy is that he seems to have a decent amount of facts. What he does with them after than is pure magic
One word. Timecube.
